meanings.definition: A condition that is the consequence of a previous disease or injury.
meanings.sent1: The sequelae of the accident included pain and limited mobility.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained the sequelae of the surgery to the patient.
meanings.sent3: The sequelae of eating too much cake were a stomachache and regret.
meanings.sent4: The sequelae of procrastination were missed deadlines and stress.
meanings.sent5: The sequelae of the storm were fallen trees and power outages.

meanings.definition: A result or effect that follows something else.
meanings.sent1: The sequelae of the argument were hurt feelings and misunderstandings.
meanings.sent2: The sequelae of the new policy were increased productivity and employee satisfaction.
meanings.sent3: The sequelae of the prank were laughter and camaraderie.
meanings.sent4: The sequelae of the decision were success and recognition.
meanings.sent5: The sequelae of the surprise party were smiles and happy tears.
